title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2: SYSTEMS AND CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Institutional capacities at national and governorate level are enhanced to ensure emergency preparedness and response in education, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from inclusive quality pre-primary, basic, secondary and nonâ€“ formal education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutional capacities at national and governorate level are enhanced to ensure emergency preparedness and response in education

description.narrative: To strengthen institutional capacities for planning and response in 2019, SCO focused on evidence-based planning through the establishment of a web-based School Integrated Management Information System (SIMIS) which is currently being piloted in 25 schools. To support institutional capacity for monitoring OOSC, UNICEF launched the child-level monitoring tool which helps track children's progress in non-formal education. SCO is also finalizing the OOSC data analysis and support final report delivery in 2020 which will strengthen OOSC programme design. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020
